title: Liverpool to rival Manchester City for £40m Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang? Wednesday's transfer gossip round-up
text:
Could Liverpool hijack Manchester City's move for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Photo: Rex Features) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jurgen Klopp could be looking to hijack Pep Guardiola 's summer plans to set up a reunion with Dortmund striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang. 
That is according to The Sun , who say Liverpool are ready to table a bid of £40million for the Gabon superstar. 
The paper claim that Klopp, who signed Aubameyang for the German side, would offload out of sorts England striker Daniel Sturridge to finance the deal. 
The 27-year-old is contracted to 2020 - which would make £40m somewhat of a bargain for one of the world's finest marksman. Wednesday's top transfer stories from the Mirror Free agent Martin Caceres has signed for Southampton until the end of the season (Photo: FIFA via Getty) 
Defender-hungry Southampton have signed free agent centre-back Martin Caceres for the rest of the season - he'll get £100,000 a week even though he hasn't played for over a year after injury and then being released by Juventus. 
Atletico Madrid president Enrique Cerezo has played down the chances of them re-signing Chelsea striker Diego Costa , while admitting he'd love the Spain international to return. Yohan Cabaye is flattered by Marseille interest (Photo: Shaun Botterill) 
Crystal Palace midfielder Yohan Cabaye has admitted he is "flattered" by interest from Marseille . The 31-year-old midfielder revealed in an interview on Tuesday that he has been contacted by the French club. Other news 
Greg Clarke has promised to step down as chairman if he fails to deliver major changes to the Football Association . But Clarke has asked the Government not to become involved in football politics and to allow him to get on with forcing through a shake-up. On Thursday, Parliament will debate a proposal that the FA is failing football. Kurt Zouma has revealed the story behind his apt middle name - "Happy" (Photo: Daily Mirror/Philip Coburn) 
Ever-cheerful Chelsea defender Kurt Zouma has told how he got the unusual but fitting middle name Happy — and how his first name is because of a character in a Jean-Claude van Damme movie. Gossip from other newspapers and websites Antoine Griezmann is going nowhere according to Atletico Madrid's president (Photo: Getty)
